page.title: 13THE STATE OF THE PARISH
page.content: The entrance to the church dates from 13th century and has suffered severe subsidence the stone courses running at 20 degrees to the horizontal.The puritans beheaded the statue of St.John the Baptist above the door but the customary pillars behind it confirm who it is. Inside the church a "weeping chancel" inclining to the south signifying the bowed head of the crucified Christ. The stained glass windows of the chancel are good Victorian work inspired by the Early English Period. The organ was rebuilt only a year ago by Osmonds of Taunton at a cost of Â£650.00 At the moment the belfry is unsafe for regular ringing of the bells but the bells are intact though unused.
